response.text: Winning a competition in architecture is a ticket to oblivion. It's just an idea. Ninety-nine per cent never get built.

response.author: Henry Louis Gates
response.text: Censorship is to art as lynching is to justice.

response.author: Aristotle
response.text: Excellence is an art won by training and habituation. We do not act rightly because we have virtue or excellence, but we rather have those because we have acted rightly. We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.

response.author: Lady Gaga
response.text: Every bit of me is devoted to love and art. And I aspire to try to be a teacher to my young fans who feel just like I felt when I was younger. I just felt like a freak. I guess what I'm trying to say is I'm trying to liberate them, I want to free them of their fears and make them feel that they can make their own space in the world.

response.author: Rosa Parks
response.text: Whatever my individual desires were to be free, I was not alone. There were many others who felt the same way.

response.author: Bernadette Peters
response.text: No One Is Alone by Stephen Sondheim is all about thinking for yourself and being your own person.

response.author: Alfred Eisenstaedt
response.text: I don't like to work with assistants. I'm already one too many the camera alone would be enough.

response.author: Peter Max
response.text: The '60s were an amazing time.

response.author: Thia Megia
response.text: Just knowing that through my music I actually inspire people is amazing for me and I find it very heartwarming.

response.author: Jenna Ushkowitz
response.text: Watching Bernadette Peters perform is like an acting class. She's amazing.

response.author: Patricia Sun
response.text: We have magnificent brains, but we use a great deal of our brilliance to keep ourselves stuck and ignorant, to keep ourselves from not shining. We are so afraid of our beauty and radiance and brilliance because it scared the adults around us when we were children.

response.author: James Weldon Johnson
response.text: I thought of Paris as a beauty spot on the face of the earth, and of London as a big freckle.

response.author: Liv Tyler
response.text: There is no definition of beauty, but when you can see someone's spirit coming through, something unexplainable, that's beautiful to me.

response.author: Oliver Evans
response.text: It frequently happens that two persons, reasoning right on a mechanical subject, think alike and invent the same thing without any communication with each other.

response.author: Edgar Winter
response.text: When I did it with Johnny, it was almost a telepathic kind of communication.

response.author: Roger Sessions
response.text: But communication is two-sided - vital and profound communication makes demands also on those who are to receive it... demands in the sense of concentration, of genuine effort to receive what is being communicated.

response.author: Mark Hyman
response.text: The power of community to create health is far greater than any physician, clinic or hospital.

response.author: Laurel Clark
response.text: I have a computer screen near my seat where I monitor the overall health of the vehicle and pick up any problems that might be occurring early on or once we see any kind of a malfunction or anything unusual that's happening, we can look at the data and figure out what that is.

response.author: Richard H. Davis
response.text: It has pleased and interested me to see how I could get along under difficult circumstances and with so much discomfort but as I say I was not sent out here to improve my temper or my health or to make me more content with my good things in the East.

response.author: Adam Smith
response.text: It is not from the benevolence of the butcher, the brewer, or the baker that we expect our dinner, but from their regard to their own interest.

response.author: Sally Kirkland
response.text: I had no idea that he was going to write that, but I've always believed that insecurity was what would keep you always in your innocence, no matter what the business did.

response.author: Antonio Banderas
response.text: If bad things are going to be said about me, I have to bear that. If I don't understand that it's part of being in show business, then I'd better go work in a bank.

response.author: Enid Bagnold
response.text: In marriage there are no manners to keep up, and beneath the wildest accusations no real criticism. Each is familiar with that ancient child in the other who may erupt again. We are not ridiculous to ourselves. We are ageless. That is the luxury of the wedding ring.

response.author: Sherri Shepherd
response.text: I'd love to have First Lady Michelle Obama over and ask, 'How do you make your marriage work?' I think the president is sexy as all get-out, but he has got to get on her nerves some kind of way. He's this wonderful, powerful man, but she sees him leaving his socks on the floor.

response.author: Chris Christie
response.text: I believe marriage should be between one man and one woman. That's my view, and that'll be the view of our state because I wouldn't sign a bill that - like the one that was in New York.

response.author: Barry Hannah
response.text: I lost my second marriage because of drinking, and I loved the woman very much. But I thought I needed booze to write. I'm glad I was disabused.

response.author: Conan O'Brien
response.text: During last night's debate, John Kerry and John Edwards were so friendly to each other some political experts think that they may end up running together. In fact Kerry and Edwards were so friendly, President Bush accused them of planning a gay marriage.

response.author: Heather O'Reilly
response.text: At least for soccer players, it comes down to a blend of two types of fitness - your base endurance, which comes from longer distance running, and your speed, which comes from sprint-based workouts.

response.author: Richard M. Daley
response.text: The spirit of the Olympic movement is great for young people because it teaches them about the training and discipline required to compete. Even if they don't make the teams, they can rededicate their lives to the art of sport, discipline, and physical fitness.

response.author: Daniela Pestova
response.text: For exercise, I now run with my chocolate Lab puppy, Oscar.

response.author: Gordon Strachan
response.text: Fitness is a curve. You can be Lance Armstrong, or you can be really out of shape at the opposite end. People enter the curve wherever they are and then they can move up the curve, by better nutrition and better exercise.

response.author: Jillian Michaels
response.text: I've always believed fitness is an entry point to help you build that happier, healthier life. When your health is strong, you're capable of taking risks. You'll feel more confident to ask for the promotion. You'll have more energy to be a better mom. You'll feel more deserving of love.
A muscle is like a car. If you want it to run well early in the morning, you have to warm it up.

response.text: I want people to use Perl. I want to be a positive ingredient of the world and make my American history. So, whatever it takes to give away my software and get it used, that's great.

response.text: There is no advertisement as powerful as a positive reputation traveling fast.

response.text: I didn't grow up identifying with beauty. I grew up thinking I could be smart and funny - those are the things I got feedback on.

response.text: 'Funny Games' was conceived as a provocation. My other films are different. If people feel my other films are, or respond to them as provocation, then that's quite different. 'Funny Games' is the only one of mine where my intention was to provoke the audience.
response.author: Michael Haneke

response.text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
response.author: Mark Twain

response.text: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.

response.text: We make the world we live in and shape our own environment.

response.author: Mitt Romney
response.text: President Obama promised to begin to slow the rise of the oceans and heal the planet. My promise... is to help you and your family.

response.author: Harry Connick, Jr.
response.text: I only tour in short bursts, I'm only ever away from my family and three daughters for a month or two.

response.author: Mitt Romney
response.text: The American culture promotes personal responsibility, the dignity of work, the value of education, the merit of service, devotion to a purpose greater than self, and at the foundation, the pre-eminence of family.

response.author: Adam Sandler
response.text: I mean, I look at my dad. He was twenty when he started having a family, and he was always the coolest dad. He did everything for his kids, and he never made us feel like he was pressured. I know that it must be a great feeling to be a guy like that.

response.author: John Mayer
response.text: Maybe someday you can accuse somebody of being a poseur by selling out and playing blues music, but that's just not going to happen in my lifetime.

response.text: Lyrics are the only thing to do with music that haven't been made easier technically.

response.author: Samuel Butler
response.text: Every man's work, whether it be literature, or music or pictures or architecture or anything else, is always a portrait of himself.
No amount of skillful invention can replace the essential element of imagination.
response.author: Edward Hopper

response.text: Only the educated are free.
response.author: Epictetus

response.text: Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any. It is wonderful how much may be done if we are always doing.
response.author: Thomas Jefferson

response.text: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
response.author: Thomas Jefferson

response.text: Never complain and never explain.
response.author: Benjamin Disraeli
John Sununu
response.text: The Internet will win because it is relentless. Like a cannibal, it even turns on it own. Though early portals like Prodigy and AOL once benefited from their first-mover status, competitors surpassed them as technology and consumer preferences changed.

response.author: Reed Hastings
response.text: Stone Age. Bronze Age. Iron Age. We define entire epics of humanity by the technology they use.

response.author: Jaron Lanier
response.text: It is impossible to work in information technology without also engaging in social engineering.

response.author: Christopher Hitchens
response.text: Ronald Reagan said that he sought a Star Wars defense only in order to share the technology with the tyrants of the U.S.S.R.

response.author: James Cameron
response.text: I was always fascinated by engineering. Maybe it was an attempt maybe to get my father's respect or interest, or maybe it was just a genetic love of technology, but I was always trying to build things.

response.author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette
response.text: It is wise to apply the oil of refined politeness to the mechanism of friendship.

response.author: Mason Cooley
response.text: Bad faith likes discourse on friendship and loyalty.

response.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
response.text: Friendship is a sheltering tree.

response.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
response.text: However rare true love may be, it is less so than true friendship.

response.author: Sophocles

response.text: Wisdom not only gets, but once got, retains.

response.text: Earthly wisdom is doing what comes naturally. Godly wisdom is doing what the Holy Spirit compels us to do.

response.text: And I would be the first to admit that probably, in a lot of press conferences over the time that I have been in coaching, indulging my own sense of humor at press conferences has not been greatly to my benefit.

response.author: Ernest Thompson Seton
response.text: At each of these northern posts there were interesting experiences in store for me, as one who had read all the books of northern travel and dreamed for half a lifetime of the north and that was - almost daily meeting with famous men.

response.author: Charlie Kaufman
response.text: I've had to deal, a lot, with my own sense of intimidation at meeting famous people - especially actors, but really any famous people.

response.author: Rod Stewart
response.text: I became famous, I think, really because of the interpretation of other people's songs, way back when, and that's what I enjoy the most. And I'm a lazy bugger.

response.author: Nicole Scherzinger
response.text: I was a shy kid, but somehow I knew I would make it as a performer. I'd always be telling my mum that I was going to be a famous singer. In my school yearbooks I would write, 'Remember me when I'm famous.' I knew I had a gift.

response.author: Jennifer Aniston
response.text: I've never sat there and plotted out how I was going to become successful or famous.
Each moment of a happy lover's hour is worth an age of dull and common life.

response.text: Once I planned to write a book of poems entirely about the things in my pocket. But I found it would be too long and the age of the great epics is past.

response.text: I would always encourage people of any age not to be so quick to follow other people's truths but to search and follow your own moral code and live by your own integrity, and mostly just be brave.

response.text: We hold that the most wonderful and splendid proof of genius is a great poem produced in a civilized age.
response.author: Thomas B. Macaulay

response.text: A truly great book should be read in youth, again in maturity and once more in old age, as a fine building should be seen by morning light, at noon and by moonlight.

response.text: I believe history will come to view 9/11 as an event on par with November 22, 1963, the date on which John F. Kennedy was murdered, cutting short a presidency that was growing ever more promising. Dreams died that day in Dallas it is easy to imagine the 1960s turning out rather differently had President Kennedy lived.

response.text: Stop this attitude that older people ain't any good anymore! We're as good as we ever were - if we ever were any good.

response.text: If you live in a ghetto and really want not to just change your life and your family's life but change your ghetto's life, make your ghetto a good neighbourhood, learn science try to be like Mark Zuckerberg, Bill Gates and Steve Jobs.

response.text: But because we live in an age of science, we have a preoccupation with corroborating our myths.
response.author: Michael Shermer

response.text: The purpose of science is not to analyze or describe but to make useful models of the world. A model is useful if it allows us to get use out of it.

response.text: The science of today is the technology of tomorrow.

response.text: Without husbands, women have to focus on earning more. They work longer hours, they're willing to relocate and they're more likely to choose higher-paying fields like technology.

response.text: I think one of the greatest enemies in the use of technology, however, is the idea that if you use the technology you have to throw other things out of the window.
response.author: John Eaton

response.text: We've been co-evolving with our technology for a hundred thousand years. Human beings and the technology we make were always inseparable. We're finally coming into this moment where it's coming inside our body for the first time in history.
